pullRequest.title: refactor(client): add ColumnType, KsqlObject, KsqlArray, BatchedQueryResult
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
This PR contains five commits based on discussion in #5236:

the first introduces the ColumnType interface which wraps an enum for column type, rather than returning column types as strings
the second introduces KsqlObject and KsqlArray which wrap the Vert.x JsonObject and JsonArray
the third renames Row#getObject() to Row#getValue()
the fourth renames QueryResult to StreamedQueryResult, in preparation for the next commit
the fifth introduces BatchedQueryResult in order to return query ID from executeQuery()

Testing done
Added/updated tests where appropriate. More test coverage coming in a follow-up PR.
Reviewer checklist

 Ensure docs are updated if necessary. (eg. if a user visible feature is being added or changed).
 Ensure relevant issues are linked (description should include text like "Fixes #")

nodes.bodyText: I would also add a method to convert to a JSON string (just delegate to the underlying method), this would be super useful.
This object is only intended to be used a return value from the API not as a general purpose JsonArray object so I'd keep the constructor hidden

nodes.bodyText: No need to use Objects.hashCode as delegate is never null, can just use delegate.hashCode()
No need to use Objects.hashCode as delegate is never null, can just use delegate.hashCode()
Would be nice to have method that gets Json string, as above.

nodes.bodyText: Done. I've added both toJsonString() and toString() (with the same implementation) in order to be explicit but I can remove toJsonString() if you think it's unncessary.
Good catch. Not sure why checkstyle didn't complain... Fixed.

nodes.bodyText: The current names StreamQueryResponseHandler and ExecuteQueryResponseHandler parallel the client methods streamQuery() and executeQuery(), in contrast to the return types StreamedQueryResult and BatchedQueryResult. If the discrepancy is confusing we can rename to either StreamQueryResult/ExecuteQueryResult or StreamedQueryResponseHandler/BatchedQueryResponseHandler but I don't think we should have a mix with StreamedQueryResponseHandler and ExecuteQueryResponseHandler. Do you have a preference?

You mean the ColumnType interface or the implementation class ColumnTypeImpl? The sort of string manipulation in this method feels odd in the interface. If we put it in the implementation, would it make more sense to instead update the constructor to perform the trimming, rather than having a static method for it? (Either's fine with me, just want to clarify what you had in mind.)
